==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|えん|き|k2=ぎ|もの|yomi=j|r=y}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=えんぎもの|縁起|tr1=engi|t1=omen; luck|物|tr2=mono|t2=thing}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|重箱読み|Jūbakoyomi}}
* {{ja-accent-common|h|え|んぎもの}}<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[ẽ̞ɴŋimo̞no̞]}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|えんぎもの|kyu=緣起物}}

# a [[talisman]], a lucky [[charm]]
#: Examples include the [[rope]] [[ties]] or [[pine]] [[bough]]s used for [[decoration]] at [[New Years]], a {{m|ja|招き猫|tr=maneki neko|lit=beckoning cat}}, a {{m|ja|達磨|tr=Daruma||Dharma doll}}, or an [[ornamental]] {{m|ja|熊手|tr=kumade||[[bamboo]] [[rake]]}} as sold in winter holiday markets in November and December.
